intro: Rhaphiostylis parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered rhaphiostylis, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with slender, branching stems. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy surface. Rhaphiostylis parvifolia is often found in coastal or moist forest habitats.
